section.title: Install the DNS Service with PowerDNS
section.para: DNS Service defaults to the PowerDNS Backend if another backend is not configured for domain name service. PowerDNS will be deployed to one or more control planes clusters. The following configuration example denotes where the PowerDNS service is installed.
To configure the backend for PowerDNS, follow these steps.

listitem.para: Ensure the DNS Service components, and the PowerDNS component have been placed on a cluster. PowerDNS may be placed on a separate cluster to the other DNS Service components.
listitem.screen:
control-planes: - name: control-plane-1 region-name: region1
clusters: - name: cluster1 service-components: - lifecycle-manager - mysql - ip-cluster - apache2 - ... - designate-api - designate-central - designate-pool-manager - designate-zone-manager - designate-mdns - designate-client - powerdns

listitem.para: Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definitions/data/network_groups.yml file to include the powerdns-ext.
listitem.screen: - name: EXTERNAL-API hostname-suffix: extapi component-endpoints: - powerdns-ext load-balancers: - provider: ip-cluster

listitem.para: Edit the ~/helion/my_cloud/definitions/data/firewall_rules.yml to allow UDP/TCP access.
listitem.screen:
- name: DNSudp # network-groups is a list of all the network group names that the rules apply to network-groups: - EXTERNAL-API rules: - type: allow # range of remote addresses in CIDR format that this rule applies to remote-ip-prefix: 0.0.0.0/0 port-range-min: 53 port-range-max: 53 protocol: udp
- name: DNStcp # network-groups is a list of all the network group names that the rules apply to network-groups: - EXTERNAL-API rules: - type: allow # range of remote addresses in CIDR format that this rule applies to remote-ip-prefix: 0.0.0.0/0 port-range-min: 53 port-range-max: 53 protocol: tcp

section.para: Please see for post installation DNS Service configuration.
